@1@ Public member function, calls the protected virtual member function {{tt|do_date_order}} of the most derived class.
@2@ Returns a value of type {{lc|std::time_base::dateorder}}, which describes the default date format used by this locale (expected by {{lc|get_date()}} and produced by {{lc|std::strftime()}} with format specifier {{c|'%x'}}).

The valid values (inherited from {{lc|std::time_base}}) are:

{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc|{{tt|no_order}}|the format contains variable items (week day, Julian day, etc), or this function is not implemented}}
{{dsc|{{tt|dmy}}|day, month, year (European locales)}}
{{dsc|{{tt|mdy}}|month, day, year (American locales)}}
{{dsc|{{tt|ymd}}|year, month, day (Asian locales)}}
{{dsc|{{tt|ydm}}|year, day, month (rare)}}
{{dsc end}}

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
A value of type {{tt|dateorder}}.

===Notes===
This function is optional, it may return {{tt|no_order}} in every case.

===Example===
{{example
|The output below was obtained using clang (libc++).
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;

void show_date_order()
{
    std::time_base::dateorder d = std::use_facet&lt;std::time_get&lt;char&gt;&gt;(
                                      std::locale()
                                  ).date_order();
    switch (d)
    {
        case std::time_base::no_order:
            std::cout &lt;&lt; "no_order\n";
            break;
        case std::time_base::dmy:
            std::cout &lt;&lt; "day, month, year\n";
            break;
        case std::time_base::mdy:
            std::cout &lt;&lt; "month, day, year\n";
            break;
        case std::time_base::ymd:
            std::cout &lt;&lt; "year, month, day\n";
            break;
        case std::time_base::ydm:
            std::cout &lt;&lt; "year, day, month\n";
            break;
    }
}

int main()
{
    std::locale::global(std::locale("en_US.utf8"));
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "In U.S. locale, the default date order is: ";
    show_date_order();

    std::locale::global(std::locale("ja_JP.utf8"));
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "In Japanese locale, the default date order is: ";
    show_date_order();

    std::locale::global(std::locale("de_DE.utf8"));
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "In German locale, the default date order is: ";
    show_date_order();
}
|p=true
|output=
In U.S. locale, the default date order is: month, day, year
In Japanese locale, the default date order is: year, month, day
In German locale, the default date order is: day, month, year
}}
